common_issues.title: Pieces OS Fails to Launch on Startup
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch, often encountering error messages or getting stuck during startup. This issue appears linked to hardware requirements, specifically older CPUs lacking AVX2 support, and large data migrations. Proposed solutions include upgrading to the latest Pieces OS version, providing system logs for diagnosis, and ensuring compatibility with system hardware.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @GetReal444 is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces application. 
* The issue seems to be related to a database service hardware requirement.

**Problems identified:**

* User's machine doesn't meet the hardware requirement for the database service (specifically, AVX2 not supported on processor).
* This issue is affecting multiple users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team is discussing solutions to address the hardware requirement issue.
* A patch is expected within 24-48 hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is not yet resolved, but the Pieces team is actively working on a solution.
* Users experiencing the issue should provide a screenshot of their machine's tech specs.

**Additional notes:**

* The Pieces team provided helpful resources to the user, including links to previous related issues, documentation, and their YouTube channel.
* The user was offered the option to schedule a call with a Pieces team member for further assistance.

**Overall, the conversation demonstrates the Pieces team's commitment to resolving user issues and their openness to communication.**

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User DevWizard24 reported an issue with Pieces not launching (similar to issues #131, #620, and #456).
* Support bot responded with resources and suggested attaching logs from c://Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/Support.
* User GetReal444 confirmed the same issue and mentioned the log request from Mark-at-pieces.
* Mark-at-pieces confirmed the issue and acknowledged stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1. They requested logs and a patch within 24-48 hours.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces version 11.1.1 has stricter hardware requirements than initially thought, causing launch issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing logs from users to diagnose the issue. 
* Implementing a patch within 24-48 hours to address the hardware compatibility problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being actively investigated and a patch is expected soon.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users experiencing similar issues are encouraged to provide their logs.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

- Users are experiencing issues where PiecesOS doesn't fully start and gets stuck on "ensure core dependency" step, leading to the tray icon being absent and PFD unable to connect.
- This seems particularly prevalent for Windows users.

**Identified Causes:**

- **Major data migration:** PiecesOS recently underwent a significant data migration from older stacks, which can take some time, especially for large user data.
- **Older Windows machines:** Issues seem related to processors older than 2015.
- **Conflicting software:** OneDrive potentially caused problems by migrating some folder/files from user documents.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

- **AppInstaller build:** Pieces team recommends the `app_installer` build for installation to help resolve issues related to the old exe installer: https://builds.pieces.app/stages/production/appinstaller/os_server.appinstaller?download=true&product=DOCUMENTATION_WEBSITE&ga_visitor=2117365959.1678367805
- **User log analysis:** Pieces support actively requested user logs from affected individuals to pinpoint and diagnose specific root causes.
- **OneDrive fix:** A patch was deployed in the next build to prevent migrating the conflicting folder/files from OneDrive.

**Current Outcome:**

- Majority of users, including Shamas-Habib and mark-at-pieces, confirmed resolution after updating to build 11.1.1.
- JasonDWilson's issue was identified as a separate, long-standing conflict with OneDrive that was successfully resolved by removing databases/documents within "com.pieces.os" in user onedrive location.
- Some lingering issues might persist for specific users based on individual configurations or hardware limitations; they are encouraged to reach out to Pieces support for further assistance.

**Overall, the conversation demonstrates proactive problem-solving and collaboration between PiecesOS team and its users to identify and address the various factors impacting the functionality of the application.**

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Freezes and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported the Pieces desktop app freezing or being unable to start. Issues included conversation titles saving prematurely, app unresponsiveness on Linux, and startup failures due to core dependency issues. Solutions involved bug fixes, app updates, disabling virtual keyboards (Linux), and addressing data migration challenges.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* The user (@seantiz) reported experiencing "odd behavior" when renaming conversations on Pieces.

**Problems identified:**

* The reported odd behavior suggests an issue with the conversation renaming functionality in the app.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces support team investigated the issue and released a patch for the Copilot & Desktop app (v3.3.5 and 3.3.6).

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user confirmed that the issue has been resolved after updating to the patched version of the app.
* The support team acknowledged the resolution and encouraged the user to report any future issues. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of clear communication between users and support teams in resolving technical issues. 
* It also demonstrates the responsiveness of the Pieces team in addressing user-reported problems.

related_issues.title: Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The issue reporter (@94tejas) reported that the Pieces app was freezing on their system.
* The Pieces support bot provided some helpful resources and related issues.
* @mack-at-pieces, a member of the Pieces team, identified the issue as a known Flutter bug impacting Linux Mint users.
* A workaround was suggested - disabling the virtual keyboard - which resolved the issue for the reporter.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was freezing on some Linux Mint systems due to a known Flutter bug with TextFields.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disabling the virtual keyboard was proposed as a workaround.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The workaround resolved the issue for the reporter.
* The Pieces team is working on a long-term fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided resources and related issues might be helpful for other users experiencing similar problems.

## Summary in One Sentence:

The reported issue of the Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint was caused by a known Flutter bug, which was resolved by disabling the virtual keyboard. The Pieces team is working on a permanent fix.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch due to hardware requirements
common_issues.description: Multiple users report PiecesOS failing to launch after a recent update. The issue seems to stem from stricter hardware requirements, particularly related to the database service needing AVX2 support. The Pieces team is working on a patch to address this, and in the meantime, users are encouraged to provide their logs for analysis.

related_issues.title: i got this error when opening localhost
related_issues.text:
i got this error when opening localhost
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a5eb05e-1c2f-4e2f-aa3a-205d8791de81)
so
when I was opening the localhost for testing I got this problem
i already search for a solution but i cant fix that
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (@WhyQwerty23811) reported an issue with accessing Pieces.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* User was provided with helpful resources while awaiting a response.
* Pieces team member (@mark-at-pieces) confirmed that Pieces is hosted on 39300, not 1000 and 3000.
* User was asked to confirm if they were experiencing issues accessing PiecesOS or the desktop.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was unable to access Pieces.
* User may have been accessing an incorrect server.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User was provided with helpful resources.
* Pieces team member clarified the correct server address.
* User was asked to provide more information about the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently open and awaiting further information from the user.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Launch and Download Failures
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch or download models, particularly on Windows and MacOS with versions 11.1.0 and 11.1.1. Issues involve stricter hardware requirements and potential incompatibility with M1 chips. Solutions include updating to the latest version, providing logs for analysis, and using specific download links for Apple Silicon.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not able to download any of the models for ollama.
[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## Conversation Summary of GitHub Issue on Ollama Installation Issue

**Key Points:**

* User (@surya-sengupta) reported an issue with Ollama installation failing.
* Pieces Support Bot suggested checking related issues and resources.
* Pieces team member (@brian-at-pieces) recommended updating to Pieces OS version 11.1.0.
* User confirmed the issue was temporarily fixed but then reappeared.
* User provided logs for further troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failed repeatedly.
* The issue reoccurred after a temporary fix.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 (initially resolved the issue).
* User provided additional logs for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still ongoing and requires further investigation by the Pieces team using the provided logs.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided log files are not included in this summary but are accessible through the links in the conversation.
* The Github issue remains open as of the last update.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of Github Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User PASimmons reported PiecesOS wouldn't run on their M1 Mac.
* Pieces support bot suggested related issues and resources.
* Mark from Pieces support asked for troubleshooting steps and offered a calendar link for real-time debugging.

**Problems Identified:**

* Incompatible build for M1 Mac.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User reinstalled Pieces using the Apple Silicon download link provided by Mark.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved. User confirmed Pieces for developers now runs fine.
* Mark acknowledged resolution and referred to ongoing announcement for further updates.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launch Failure
common_issues.description: Users are reporting failures to launch PiecesOS after a recent update. The issue seems to stem from stricter hardware requirements, particularly related to AVX2 processor support. The Pieces team is working on a patch to address this and encourages affected users to share their logs for further diagnosis.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path: 

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 4c9e86c3-7cd9-4905-84a3-be29a48a5a26
User: Anonymous
Current Version: Unknown
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-50-generic #51-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Nov  9 17:58:29 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Timeline:**

* **2025-02-03:** @Nagarajan2004 creates the issue.
* **2025-02-10:** @mack-at-pieces reaches out for troubleshooting.

**Key Points Raised:**

* @Nagarajan2004 is experiencing issues with the Pieces Copilot Service.
* The issue is similar to other reported issues (#564, #591, #131).

**Problems Identified:**

* The user is unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Check related issues and resources.
* Contact @mack-at-pieces through a calendar booking for live troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the user responded or the issue was resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The original issue description might hold more clues about the specific problem.

* The issue is being actively investigated and a patch is expected soon.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users experiencing similar issues are encouraged to provide their logs.

recommendations: **Address Pieces OS Launch Failures:** Prioritize resolving the hardware requirement issues and M1 chip incompatibility causing Pieces OS launch failures. This is the most frequent and impactful problem reported.
**Improve Data Migration Process:** Investigate and optimize the data migration process, as it contributes to startup delays and failures, especially on older hardware.

**Review Virtual Keyboard Functionality (Linux):** Investigate the root cause of the Pieces desktop app freezing on Linux Mint due to virtual keyboard issues and implement a permanent fix beyond the current workaround.

**Provide Clear Hardware Requirements Communication:** Clearly communicate Pieces OS hardware requirements to users, potentially including a system check during installation, to prevent future compatibility issues.
**Enhance Model Download Stability:** Investigate and address the root causes of model download failures, particularly for Ollama, ensuring a smooth user experience.
**Monitor and Address Linux-Specific Issues:** Allocate resources to proactively monitor and address Linux-specific issues, as they represent a significant portion of recent problems.

**Continue Gathering User Logs:** Encourage users experiencing issues to provide logs for faster diagnosis and resolution, particularly for less frequent but persistent problems like Neural Code Search failures and LTM sandbox issues.
